title: 112_hr2867
content: The Act is titled the "United States Commission on International Religious Freedom Reform and Reauthorization Act of 2011." It establishes that each member of the Commission shall serve a 2-year term and may not serve more than 2 terms. Members who have completed 2 full terms will have their term expire 90 days after such date. The Act establishes term limits for members of the Commission, stating that they may not serve more than 2 terms. If a member attends less than 75% of meetings during a term, they are ineligible for reappointment. Additionally, members are not eligible to be elected as Chair for a second consecutive term. Members are also subject to federal travel regulations. The International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to include requirements for Commission members to adhere to federal travel regulations and Department of State Standardized Regulations. Additionally, antidiscrimination laws are applied for addressing violations related to employment rights and protections. The International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to include protections against employment discrimination, fair labor standards, and other worker rights. Pending claims can be maintained under specific provisions. Authorization of appropriations is also addressed. Termination dates are extended, and a report on program effectiveness is required. SEC. 7. REPORT ON EFFECTIVENESS OF PROGRAMS TO PROMOTE RELIGIOUS FREEDOM. The Comptroller General of the United States will submit a report on the implementation of the Act and its amendments, consulting with congressional committees and organizations. The report will review the effectiveness of US programs promoting international religious freedom, assess the Office on International Religious Freedom, and review the role of the Ambassador at Large for International Religious Freedom.
